questions.text: Odds ratio is:

options.label: A
options.text: Odds of being disease in exposed divided by odds of being disease in non- exposed

options.label: B
options.text: Odds of being exposed in cases divided by odds of being exposed in controls

options.label: C
options.text: Odds of being disease in exposed divided by odds of being non disease in non- exposed

options.label: D
options.text: Odds of being exposed in cases divided by odds of being non exposed in controls

questions.correct_answer: B. Odds of being exposed in cases divided by odds of being exposed in controls
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • OR = Odds of being exposed among cases Odds of being exposed among controls
  • • Relative risk=Incidence of disease in exposed Incidence of disease in non-exposed

A 75-year-old man American association anaesthesiology class-III (ASA-III) with a history of coronary artery disease, chronic renal disease, and obstructive sleep apnea is taken to the operating room for inguinal hernia repair. He had been seen by a cardiologist and cleared for surgery. General anesthesia via LMA is considered with maintenance using desflurane. Vital signs are normal prior to pre-op, and induction and placement of the LMA are uneventful. Ten minutes later, during surgical prep, the patient's vital signs show HR 115/min, BP 148/96 mmHg, RR 14/min, ETCO2 40 mmhg & SpO2 99%. The end-tidal desflurane value reads 8.5, and the only other medication administered at this point was cefazolin. What is the most likely cause for the patient's clinical condition?

options.label: D
options.text: Allergic reaction to perioperative antibiotic administered

questions.text: A 65-year-old male, heavy smoker, with COPD is having micro laryngeal surgery under general anaesthesia. He is intubated and ventilated. During the procedure, his saturation on pulse oximeter start to dip and he develops an expiratory wheeze, and it is getting difficult to ventilate. Which of the statements below is the most appropriate in the immediate management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Increase the ventilation pressures to improve oxygenation.

options.label: B
options.text: Salbutamol via tracheal tube or intravenously may be beneficial.

options.label: C
options.text: Intravenous corticosteroids should be administered immediately.

options.label: D
options.text: The airway device may be changed to a laryngeal mask airway (LMA)

questions.correct_answer: B. Salbutamol via tracheal tube or intravenously may be beneficial.

questions.text: Maximum FiO2 is delivered by which device?

A 43-year-old woman says that when she is under stress, she often feels as if she is “outside of herself” and is watching her life as though it were a play. She knows that this perception is only a feeling and that she is really living her life. This woman is showing evidence of
Catastrophic reaction is seen in:
All of the following drugs should be withdrawn before administering ECT (Electroconvulsive therapy) except?
The major neurotransmitter system involved in development of substance abuse and substance dependence is?

options.label: A
options.text: Dopaminergic neurons from ventral tegmental area to nucleus accumbens

options.label: B
options.text: Nor adrenergic neurons from the locus ceruleus

options.label: D
options.text: Serotonergic neurons from the raphe nuclei

questions.correct_answer: A. Dopaminergic neurons from ventral tegmental area to nucleus accumbens

questions.text: A 23-year-old man comes to the physician with the complaint that his memory has worsened over the past 2 months and that he has difficulty concentrating. He has lost interest in his friends and his work. He has difficulty with abstract thoughts and problem solving. He has also felt depressed. MRI scan shows parenchymal abnormalities. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 55 years old P2L2 has come with a history of post-menopausal bleeding since last 3 months. On examination, her cervix and vagina appeared normal. She has no other complaints. What is the next line of action?
Which one of the following is not used in a case of menopausal symptom of vaginal dryness and dyspareunia?
Which one of the following drugs will be used in the treatment of Sheehan’s syndrome?
Which one of the following is not an indication of using the following suture material?

options.label: A
options.text: Closing the subcutaneous tissue during abdominal hysterectomy

options.label: C
options.text: Closing the blind space during abdominal myomectomy

questions.text: A 45 years old patient presented with complaints of pain and abdomen and menorrhagia since last 9 months. Endometrial biopsy was normal and sonography of uterus revealed uniformly enlarged uterus with no adnexal mass and no focal lesion in the myometrium. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a reason for prolapse of uterus?
A 52 years old female P2L2 with postmenopausal bleeding had endometrial biopsy report suggestive of endometrial hyperplasia without atypia. What should be the treatment of choice in this patient?
A 33 years old nulliparous patient has AUB-L with FIGO type 2 fibroid of 7 cm. She is also suffering from PCOS and wants to conceive. What is the right plan of action for her?
questions.correct_answer: D. Laparoscopic myomectomy followed by letrozole

questions.text: A person is genotypically male, phenotypically female and has presence of Mullerian structures. This is possible in?

A 60 years old post-menopausal patient has endometrial cancer. Which of the following character corresponds to Type 1 endometrial cancer?

options.label: D
options.text: Poor prognosis as compared to type 2 cancer

questions.text: Which one of the following clinical condition requires treatment with the following device?
The most common complication arising from a mature cystic teratoma of ovary is?

A 32 years old nulliparous patient had molar pregnancy which was treated by suction evacuation. She was kept under surveillance and her HCG was evaluated every week. The most specific characteristic feature of the development of gestational choriocarcinoma amongst the following is?
A 46 years old multiparous patient has dysmenorrhea as well as dyspareunia. Which one of the following is not the likely cause of these symptoms?
At 25 years old patient is pregnant for the first time. She has full term gestation. She is in first stage of Labour. The segments involved in labour pain during first stage of Labour are?
Which of the following patients should not undergo VBAC delivery?

options.label: A
options.text: Past history of cesarean for breech delivery

options.label: B
options.text: Past history of cesarean for fetal distress

options.label: C
options.text: Past history of myomectomy of FIGO type 2-5 fibroid in the fundal region

options.label: D
options.text: Previous LSCS with lower transverse incision on the uterus

questions.correct_answer: C. Past history of myomectomy of FIGO type 2-5 fibroid in the fundal region

questions.text: Which one of the following is an absolute contraindication for vacuum delivery?
Which of the following is not a physiological change in the carbohydrate metabolism in pregnancy?
Regarding cardiovascular system physiological changes in pregnancy, which of the following statement is correct?

options.label: B
options.text: Decrease in cardiac output immediately after delivery

questions.correct_answer: D. Decrease in systemic vascular resistance

questions.text: Patient is suffering from hyperemesis gravidarum. Which of the following is possibly decreased?
Routine Investigations done in a pregnant female are all except:
Which one of the following is physiologically seen regarding thyroid in pregnancy?

options.label: B
options.text: Free T3 and T4 levels increase in pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: Thyroid binding globulins are increased in pregnancy

questions.correct_answer: C. Thyroid binding globulins are increased in pregnancy

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a feature of Sheehan syndrome?
Identify the given procedure?
Of the following, the electrolyte abnormality that is often found in infants born to women with diabetes mellitus is:
Of the following, the most appropriate technique to provide effective chest compressions in a newborn is:

options.label: A
options.text: Apply compressions over the upper third of the newborn’s sternum

options.label: B
options.text: Compress to a depth one-third the anterior–posterior diameter of the chest

options.label: C
options.text: Provide chest compressions and bag-mask breaths in a ratio of 2:1

options.label: D
options.text: Use the two-finger technique instead of the two-thumb encircling-hands approach

questions.correct_answer: B. Compress to a depth one-third the anterior–posterior diameter of the chest

questions.text: The pediatrician is concerned about a possible diagnosis of biliary atresia in a 4 weeks old baby, and consults with a pediatric surgeon. The surgeon performs a percutaneous liver biopsy that confirms this diagnosis. The surgeon then meets with the family to discuss this disease. Of the following, the most accurate statement about biliary atresia is:

options.label: A
options.text: Biliary atresia is an uncommon cause of cholestasis in neonates.

options.label: B
options.text: Biliary atresia is the most common reason for a liver transplant in children.

options.label: C
options.text: The majority of infants with biliary atresia appear unhealthy, with poor growth at 3 to 6 weeks of age.

options.label: D
options.text: The majority of infants with biliary atresia have other congenital malformations.

questions.correct_answer: B. Biliary atresia is the most common reason for a liver transplant in children.

questions.text: A 10 weeks baby got DPT vaccine at 6 weeks. The baby got fever>40.5 C and severe inconsolable cry. What should be done at 10 weeks?
Mechanism of action of Plasma exchange in TTP
questions.correct_answer: B. Removes antibody and adds ADAMTS

questions.text: In a Meconium stained liquor delivery, what should be done?

options.label: A
options.text: Before delivery of shoulder, suction mouth then nose

options.label: B
options.text: PPV in non vigorous child after initial steps

options.label: D
options.text: Tracheal suctioning in non vigorous baby

questions.correct_answer: B. PPV in non vigorous child after initial steps
